arm_group.description: Surgery in the left breast under left thoracic paravertebral block and HRV

arm_group.arm_group_label: Right thoracic paravertebral block and HRV
arm_group.description: Surgery in the right breast under right thoracic paravertebral block and HRV

brief_summary.textblock:
The Left thoracic paravertebral block have a different effect on heart's autonomic nervous
      system, as measured with Heart Rate Variability, compared to Right interscalene block

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Thoracic Paravertebral Block on Heart Rate Variability (HRV)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Elective breast surgery

          -  Age 20 - 65 years

          -  ASA I - II

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Coagulopathy disorders

          -  Infection at the puncture site for the thoracic paravertebral block

          -  Severe kyphoscoliosis

          -  Allergy to local anesthetics

          -  BMI > 35

          -  Psychiatric disorders

          -  Patient's refusal

          -  Problems with patient communication

          -  Arrythmia

          -  Ischaemic heart disease

          -  Diabetes mellitus

          -  Thyroid function disorders

          -  Patients with conduction disorders on the ECG

          -  Electrolyte disorders (K+, Na+, Ca++)

          -  Patients on medication that affect the ECG

intervention.arm_group_label: Right thoracic paravertebral block and HRV

clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Thoracic Paravertebral Block on the Autonomous System as Measured by Heart Rate Variability (HRV)

primary_outcome.description: The Left thoracic paravertebral block has different effect on heart's autonomic nervous system, as measured with HRV, than the Right.
primary_outcome.measure: Effect of thoracic paravertebral block on Heart Rate Variability (HRV)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 30 min after the application of the thoracic paravertebral block

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective
